Value.label: Night Light
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON. Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

Value.label: Report threshold
Value.Help: Enable selective reporting only when power change reaches a certain threshold or percentage set in 4.11 below. This is used to reduce network traffic.

Value.label: Whole Smart Strip Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Whole Smart Strip).

Value.label: Socket 1 Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 1).

Value.label: Socket 2 Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 2).

Value.label: Socket 3 Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 3).

Value.label: Socket 4 Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 4).

Value.label: Socket 5 Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 5).

Value.label: Socket 6 Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 6).

Value.label: Whole Smart Strip Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Whole Smart Strip).

Value.label: Socket 1 Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 1).

Value.label: Socket 2 Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 2).

Value.label: Socket 3 Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 3).

Value.label: Socket 4 Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 4).

Value.label: Socket 5 Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 5).

Value.label: Socket 6 Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce an automatic report (Socket 6).

Value.label: Notification status
Value.Help: Defines the automated status notification of an associated device when status changes

Value.label: Temperature of Smart Strip
Value.Help: Get temperature of Smart Strip

Value.label: Default Group Reports
Value.Help: Set report types for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Report type sent in Reporting Group 1
Value.Help: Configure auto report which information as Group 1. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 bit 7 reserved bit 6 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 6) bit 5 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 5) bit 4 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 4) bit 3 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 3) bit 2 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 2) bit 1 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 1) bit 0 Auto report the total power level with specified time interval Value 4 (lsb) bit 7 reserved bit 6 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 6) bit 5 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 5) bit 4 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 4) bit 3 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 3) bit 2 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 2) bit 1 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 1) bit 0 Auto report the total power consumption with specified time interval

Value.label: Report type sent in Reporting Group 2
Value.Help: Configure auto report which information as Group 2. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 bit 7 reserved bit 6 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 6) bit 5 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 5) bit 4 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 4) bit 3 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 3) bit 2 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 2) bit 1 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 1) bit 0 Auto report the total power level with specified time interval Value 4 (lsb) bit 7 reserved bit 6 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 6) bit 5 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 5) bit 4 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 4) bit 3 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 3) bit 2 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 2) bit 1 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 1) bit 0 Auto report the total power consumption with specified time interval

Value.label: Report type sent in Reporting Group 3
Value.Help: Configure auto report which information as Group 3. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 bit 7 reserved bit 6 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 6) bit 5 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 5) bit 4 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 4) bit 3 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 3) bit 2 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 2) bit 1 Auto report power level with specified time interval (channel 1) bit 0 Auto report the total power level with specified time interval Value 4 (lsb) bit 7 reserved bit 6 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 6) bit 5 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 5) bit 4 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 4) bit 3 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 3) bit 2 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 2) bit 1 Auto report power consumption with specified time interval (channel 1) bit 0 Auto report the total power consumption with specified time interval

Value.label: Set 111-113 to default
Value.Help: Set time interval for sending reports for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Send Interval for Reporting Group 1
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 1 is sent.

Value.label: Send Interval for Reporting Group 2
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 2 is sent.

Value.label: Send Interval for Reporting Group 3
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 3 is sent.

Value.label: Configuration Locked
Value.Help: Enable/disable Configuration Locked

Value.label: Enter Meter Calibration Mode
Value.Help: Enter Meter Calibration Mode

Value.label: Device tag
Value.Help: Device tag.

Value.label: Reset device
Value.Help: Reset to the default configuration.

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: turns relay off once voltage exceeds 16.5A for over 5 secs if enabled

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Recovery state for power failure

Value.label: On/Off Status Change Notifications
Value.Help: Send notifications to associated devices

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: LED Indicator Control

Item.label: Display power consumption at state change

Value.label: Power Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: Minimum change in watts to report

Value.label: Power Report Percentage Threshold
Value.Help: Minimum percentage change to report

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report power consumption (W) in secs

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report energy usage (KWH) in secs

Value.label: Voltage Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report voltage (V) in secs

Value.label: Electricity Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report electrical current (A) in secs

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: turns relay off once voltage exceeds 16.5A for over 5 secs if enabled

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Recovery state for power failure

Value.label: On/Off Status Change Notifications
Value.Help: Send notifications to associated devices

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: LED Indicator Control

Item.label: Display power consumption at state change

Value.label: Power Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: Minimum change in watts to report

Value.label: Power Report Percentage Threshold
Value.Help: Minimum percentage change to report

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report power consumption (W) in secs

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report energy usage (KWH) in secs

Value.label: Voltage Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report voltage (V) in secs

Value.label: Electricity Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report electrical current (A) in secs

Value.label: System Type
Value.Help: 0 = Standard, 1 = Heat Pump

Value.label: Fan Type
Value.Help: 0 = Gas (no fan w/Heat), 1 = Electric (Fan w/Heat)

Value.label: Change Over Type
Value.Help: 0 = w/Cool, 1 = w/Heat

Value.label: 2nd Stage Heat Enable
Value.Help: 0 = no 2nd stage heat, 1 = 2nd stage heat

Value.label: Aux Heat Enable
Value.Help: 0 = no aux heat, 1 = aux heat enabled

Value.label: 2nd Stage Cool Enable
Value.Help: 0 = no 2nd stage cool, 1 = 2nd stage cool

Value.label: Temperature Unit
Value.Help: 0 = Celsius, 1 = Fahrenheit

Value.label: Minimum Off Time
Value.Help: Sets the Minimum Off Time (MOT) delay before another heating/cooling cycle can begin

Value.label: Minimum Run Time
Value.Help: Sets the Minimum Run Time (MRT) delay before a heating/cooling cycle can turn of

Value.label: Setpoint H/C Delta
Value.Help: Sets the minimum separation between heating and cooling setpoints

Value.label: H Delta Stage 1 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating starts

Value.label: H Delta Stage 1 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating stops

Value.label: H Delta Stage 2 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating starts

Value.label: H Delta Stage 2 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delay from setpoint that stage 2 heating stops

Value.label: H Delta Aux ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating starts

Value.label: H Delta Stage 2 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating stops

Value.label: C Delta Stage 1 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling starts

Value.label: C Delta Stage 1 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling stops

Value.label: C Delta Stage 2 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling starts

Value.label: C Delta Stage 2 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling stops

Value.label: Display Lock
Value.Help: Display Lock

Value.label: Backlight Timer
Value.Help: Sets the time from last button press that the backlight will turn OFF

Value.label: Max Heat Setpoint
Value.Help: Sets the maximum heating setpoint value

Value.label: Min Cool Setpoint
Value.Help: Sets the minimum cooling setpoint value

Value.label: Schedule Enable
Value.Help: Enable or disable thermostat's local scheduler

Value.label: Run/Hold Mode
Value.Help: 0 = Hold, 1 = Run

Value.label: Setback Mode
Value.Help: 0 = No setback, 2 = Un-occupied mode

Value.label: Un-Occupied HSP
Value.Help: Heat Setpoint for Unoccupied mode

Value.label: Un-Occupied CSP
Value.Help: Cool Setpoint for Unoccupied mode

Value.label: Remote Sensor 1 Node Number
Value.Help: Node number for Remote Sensor 1

Value.label: Remote Sensor 1 Temperature
Value.Help: Temperature of Remote Sensor 1

Value.label: Internal Sensor Temp Offset
Value.Help: Internal Sensor Temperature Offset

Value.label: R1 Sensor Temp Offset
Value.Help: R1 Sensor Temperature Offset

Value.label: Filter Timer
Value.Help: Timer to let know when to change or clean the filter

Value.label: Max Filter Timer
Value.Help: Maximum allowed value for filter timer

Value.label: Heat Timer
Value.Help: Heat Timer in hours

Value.label: Cool Timer
Value.Help: Cool Timer in hours

Value.label: Fan Purge Heat
Value.Help: Fan purge period for Heat mode

Value.label: Fan Purge Cool
Value.Help: Fan purge period for Cool mode

Value.label: Control Mode
Value.Help: Set the switch to control other devices or issue various scene activation commands to a central controller.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Group.label: Top/bottom button click and holding down
Top/bottom button double-click and holding down

Value.label: Control Mode
Value.Help: Set the switch to control other devices or issue various scene activation commands to a central controller.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Group.label: Top/bottom button click and holding down
Top/bottom button double-click and holding down

Value.label: Clear Pulse Meter Counts
Value.Help: Clear Pulse Meter Counts (actual value is dont care; count gets reset whenever this command is received regardless of value). This parameter is for SIG1 only.

Value.label: Trigger Mapping
Value.Help: SIG1 triggered/untriggered sets or clears Relay1. Refer to description in User Manual under section, Input to Relay Mapping. Note that neither a Basic Report nor a Binary Switch Report is sent when relay is automatically set or cleared by Trigger Mapping. Only applies to the Relay1 output.

Value.label: Lower Threshold, High
Value.Help: SIG1 high lower threshold. Must be less than Upper Threshold Low and greater than Lower Threshold Low.

Value.label: Lower Threshold, Low
Value.Help: SIG1 low lower threshold.

Value.label: Upper Threshold, High
Value.Help: SIG1 high upper threshold.

Value.label: Upper Threshold, Low
Value.Help: SIG1 low upper threshold. Must be greater than Lower Threshold High and less than Upper Threshold High.

Value.label: Input Flags
Value.Help: Bits 7 - 2 are ignored and should be set to 0 Bit1 : Digital-Configuration flag 1=Set Trigger levels for this channel to digital thresholds (approx. 1V); Default 0=Set Trigger levels to analog thresholds (see parameters 4 through 7) Bit0 : Trigger-Between-Thresholds flag (see below) 1 = Set to triggered when input falls between thresholds; Default 0 = Set to triggered when input falls outside of thresholds

Item.label: Trigger outside thresholds, analog trigger thresholds
Trigger between thresholds, analog trigger thresholds
Trigger outside thresholds, digital trigger thresholds
Trigger between thresholds, digital trigger thresholds

Value.label: Sensor/Pulse Report Interval
Value.Help: Periodic send interval of Multilevel Sensor Reports (Association Group 2) and/or Pulse Count Reports (Association Group 5) for SIG1. This parameter has a resolution of 10 seconds; for example, 1 = 10 seconds, 2 = 20 seconds, 3 = 30 seconds (Default), ... 255 = 2550 seconds = 42.5 minutes. A value of 0 disables automatic reporting.

Value.label: Momentary Relay1 enable/disable
Value.Help: Momentary Relay1 output enable/disable. 1..255 = enable / value sets the approximate momentary on time in increments of 100msec.

Value.label: Control Mode
Value.Help: Set the switch to control other devices or issue various scene activation commands to a central controller.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Group.label: Top/bottom button click and holding down
Top/bottom button double-click and holding down

Value.label: Audio Mode
Value.Help: Disable the door sensor alarm function.

Value.label: Re-lock Time
Value.Help: seconds; after successful code entry and unit unlocks, it will automatically re-lock after specified time (30 = default value)

Value.label: Wrong Code Entry Limit
Value.Help: The number of invalid code entries lock will accept before sending TAMPER Alarm. When number of wrong code entries is exceeded, lock will disable keypad for the time specified by Shutdown Time parameter. (5 = default)

Value.label: Language
Value.Help: The number of invalid code entries lock will accept before sending TAMPER Alarm. When number of wrong code entries is exceeded, lock will disable keypad for the time specified by Shutdown Time parameter. (5 = default)

Value.label: Shutdown Time
Value.Help: number of seconds unit will be inoperable after number of wrong code entries is exceeded (30 = default)

Value.label: Operating Mode
Value.Help: The number of invalid code entries lock will accept before sending TAMPER Alarm. When number of wrong code entries is exceeded, lock will disable keypad for the time specified by Shutdown Time parameter. (5 = default)

Value.label: Lock Mode - unlocking sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate Lock Mode and set up unlocking sequence. Device will lock after time set in parameter 2 or after pressing and holding selected button. 0 - Lock Mode disabled. 9-28086 - unlocking sequence. See "Lock Mode" on page 9 for more information.

Value.label: Lock Mode - time to lock and locking button
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last press of the button to lock the device and locking button. Setting locking button will deactivate associations and scenes for pressing and holding the selected button. This parameter is irrelevant if parameter 1 is set to 0 (Lock Mode disable). 0 - Lock Mode disabled. 5-1791- calculated value. See "Lock Mode" on page 9 for more information

Value.label: First scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 7. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Second scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 8. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Third scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 9. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Fourth scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 10. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Fifth scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 11. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Sixth scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 12. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Sequences - timeout
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last press of the button to check if the sequence is valid. Available settings: 5-30 (0.5-3s, 0.1s step) - time to lock

Value.label: Single button associations - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating mode for single button associations.

Item.label: Single press switches state to opposite
Single press switches state to opposite, double press sets to maximum level
Single press turns on, double press turns off

Value.label: Value sent to Square association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Circle association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Cross association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Triangle association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Minus association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Plus association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Paired buttons association for Square and Circle
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for Square and Circle buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to Square groups. Circle turns devices on and increases value, Square turns them off and decreases value.

Value.label: Paired buttons association for Cross and Triangle
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for Cross and Triangle buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to Cross groups. Triangle turns devices on and increases value, Cross turns them off and decreases value.

Value.label: Paired buttons association for Minus and Plus
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for Minus and Plus buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to Minus groups. Plus turns devices on and increases value, Minus turns them off and decreases value.

Value.label: Scene activation for Square button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Circle button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Cross button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Triangle button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Minus button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Plus button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
Value.Help: Parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: using Security Mode or not. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network Security Mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline association group. 1 : 2nd group sent using Security Mode. 2 : 3rd group sent using Security Mode. 4 : 4th group sent using Security Mode. 8 : 5th group sent using Security Mode. 16 : 6th group sent using Security Mode. 32 : 7th group sent using Security Mode. 64 : 8th group sent using Security Mode. 128 : 9th group sent using Security Mode. 256 : 10th group sent using Security Mode. 512 : 11th group sent using Security Mode. 1024 : 12th group sent using Security Mode. 2048 : 13th group sent using Security Mode.

Value.label: Control Mode
Value.Help: Set the switch to control other devices or issue various scene activation commands to a central controller.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Group.label: Top/bottom button click and holding down
Top/bottom button double-click and holding down

Value.label: Control Mode
Value.Help: Set the switch to control other devices or issue various scene activation commands to a central controller.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Group.label: Top/bottom button click and holding down
Top/bottom button double-click and holding down
